docs.snippet: Aaron Harrison put up the shot that sent the Wildcats into the title game against Connecticut....
docs.lead_paragraph: Aaron Harrison put up the shot that sent the Wildcats into the title game against Connecticut.
docs.abstract: Kentucky defeats Wisconsin, 74-73, in Final Four action; freshman guard Aaron Harrison sinks 3-pointer with 5.7 seconds remaining, taking Kentucky to NCAA tournament title game.

headline.main: With Late 3-Pointer, Kentucky Edges Wisconsin to Advance to Final
headline.print_headline: Two Long Shots Close In on Their Goal

docs.snippet: The N.C.A.A. has moved the Final Four to giant football stadiums to sell more tickets, but the intimate feel in which basketball thrives has been lost....
docs.lead_paragraph: The N.C.A.A. has moved the Final Four to giant football stadiums to sell more tickets, but the intimate feel in which basketball thrives has been lost.
docs.abstract: Juliet Macur Sports of The Times column holds that NCAA has moved the Final Four to giant football stadiums to sell more tickets, but the intimate feel in which basketball thrives has been lost; says NCAA is telling everyone that they should embrace this awful trend that has spoiled one of the greatest live sporting events.

headline.main: When Money Talks, Game Is Drowned Out at Big Stadiums
headline.print_headline: When Money Talks, Game Is Drowned Out at Big Stadiums

docs.snippet: Among the biggest complaints about the N.C.A.A. is that it has aggressively monetized nearly every aspect of its championships while it forbids players to negotiate paid endorsement deals....
docs.lead_paragraph: Among the biggest complaints about the N.C.A.A. is that it has aggressively monetized nearly every aspect of its championships while it forbids players to negotiate paid endorsement deals.
docs.abstract: One of the mainstays of the NCAA tournament is the prominence of the logos of corporate sponsors alongside the NCAA’s; in total, some 19 major partners and corporate supporters are listed in the official fan guide of the Final Four; NCAA’s opponents are using it as fresh ammunition in fight for change in policies concerning student athletes.

headline.seo: Financial Rewards of N.C.A.A.’s Sponsorship Deals Aren’t Shared With Players
headline.main: Points for Product Placement: N.C.A.A. Cashes In, but Not the Players
headline.print_headline: Points for Product Placement: N.C.A.A. Cashes In, but Not the Players

byline.contributor: Karen Crouse and Viv Bernstein contributed reporting.

docs.snippet: In 2014, the percentage of African-American head coaches is at its lowest level since the 1995-96 season....
docs.lead_paragraph: In 2014, the percentage of African-American head coaches is at its lowest level since the 1995-96 season.
docs.abstract: William C Rhoden Sports of The Times column holds that new group of black college basketball coaches is looking for a voice and a cause; contends issue staring them in the face is the declining numbers in their ranks; percentage of African-American head coaches is at its lowest level since the 1995-96 season.

headline.main: As Their Numbers Fall, College Basketball’s Black Coaches Face a Conundrum

headline.main: Ohio U Hires North Dakota St's Phillips as Coach
